neighbors.name: Salt River Project Ag Imp & Power Dist
neighbors.claims: Salt River Project is a state-chartered power and water utility ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salt_River_Project#:~:text=The%20Salt%20River%20Project%20,3%20companies%20in%20Arizona)); see ORG table.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through SRP's formal channels for landowner coordination.

neighbors.name: State Of Arizona
neighbors.claims: Arizona State Land Department manages this state trust land in the area ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arizona_State_Land_Department#:~:text=The%20Arizona%20State%20Land%20Department,owned%20lands%20and%20property)); see ORG table.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate via the Arizona State Land Dept per official process.

neighbors.name: Chavez Juan Andres Colozo Jr
neighbors.claims: No references to Juan Andres Colozo Chavez Jr were found in local news or civic records ([pinal.novusagenda.com](https://pinal.novusagenda.com/AgendaPublic/MeetingView.aspx?MeetingID=1383&MinutesMeetingID=-1&doctype=Agenda#:~:text=No%20,chavez)). He is identified only through property ownership and holds no known public roles ([pinal.novusagenda.com](https://pinal.novusagenda.com/AgendaPublic/MeetingView.aspx?MeetingID=1454&MinutesMeetingID=759&doctype=Agenda#:~:text=No%20,chavez)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally with project information and invite any questions given his low profile.

neighbors.name: Gable & Hardison Farming
neighbors.claims: Gable & Hardison Farming is a local family farming operation (Hardison family) in San Tan Valley ([searchagriculture.az.gov](https://searchagriculture.az.gov/mastercontent/pgpall.aspx#:~:text=...,SAN%20TAN%20VALLEY)); see ORG table.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via known agricultural networks (see ORG profile for recommended engagement).

neighbors.name: Nevitt Farms LLLP
neighbors.claims: Nevitt Farms LLLP is a family farming partnership associated with John O. Nevitt ([searchagriculture.az.gov](https://searchagriculture.az.gov/SearchAg/PGP/PGPAll#:~:text=11167%20%20,12%2F31%2F2021)); see ORG table.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through the partnership's principal (see ORG profile for further guidance).

neighbors.name: Jon M. Correll & Elisa M. Correll
neighbors.claims: Jon M. Correll (age 62) resides in San Tan Valley, Arizona ([veripages.com](https://veripages.com/name/Jon/Correll/#:~:text=Age%2062%2C%20Born%20Jul%201963,3561)). He is also known as Jon Michael Correll, but no public records indicate any civic positions or activism by Jon or Elisa Correll ([veripages.com](https://veripages.com/name/Jon/Correll/#:~:text=Also%20known%20as)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personable, one-on-one approach to explain the project and listen to any concerns, as the Corrells have no evident prior stance or public involvement.

neighbors.name: Darryl Scott Darger & Kristi Lynn Kruger
neighbors.claims: Dr. Darryl “Scott” Darger is a veterinarian who has practiced in Arizona’s East Valley for about 20 years ([www.santanvet.com](https://www.santanvet.com/about-us/team/dr-scott-darger.html#:~:text=Dr,Medicine%20from%20Colorado%20State%20University)). He co-owns property in Pinal County with Kristi Lynn Kruger; Darger also established an Arizona LLC in his name in 1997 that remains active ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-az/daryl-scott-darger-llc--L08112595#:~:text=Arizona%20,28%20years%20ago)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community liaison familiar with animal welfare explain how project plans protect local wildlife and pets, aligning outreach with Dr. Darger’s veterinary concern for animals.

neighbors.name: Bobby Watkins
neighbors.claims: Bobby Watkins is listed as an owner of a parcel in this area, but searches did not reveal any public social or news presence by him ([obituaries.mineralwellsindex.com](https://obituaries.mineralwellsindex.com/obituary/bobby-watkins-1071143016#:~:text=Bobby%20Watkins%20,Bobby%20Ray%20Watkins%20Bobby%20Ray)). No meeting records or media reports were found that mention Bobby Watkins in a civic context as of this writing ([obituaries.mineralwellsindex.com](https://obituaries.mineralwellsindex.com/obituary/bobby-watkins-1071143016#:~:text=Bobby%20Watkins%20,Bobby%20Ray%20Watkins%20Bobby%20Ray)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Watkins with direct, respectful communication at his doorstep, focusing on clear information about property impacts, since he has no known public stance or affiliations to leverage.

neighbors.name: Christian J. Watkins
neighbors.claims: Christian J. Watkins maintains a public online presence focused on secular and scientific commentary ([christianwatkins75.wixsite.com](https://christianwatkins75.wixsite.com/christianwatkins#:~:text=Christian%20J)). He was a competitive debater for several years, indicating he is articulate and engages in analytical discussions ([christianwatkins75.wixsite.com](https://christianwatkins75.wixsite.com/christianwatkins#:~:text=Christian%20J,Finally%2C%20Christian%20participates%20in%20interviews)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide detailed, fact-based project information to Mr. Watkins and invite questions, appealing to his analytical mindset and interest in evidence-driven dialogue.

neighbors.name: David A. Christianson
neighbors.claims: David A. Christianson owns two adjacent parcels in Pinal County, but he has no recorded appearances in local news or civic meetings ([benitolink.com](https://benitolink.com/listings/items/david-christianson/#:~:text=Christianson%20and%20his%20sister%20Ann,placed%20family%20above%20all%20else)). Public record searches did not identify any community positions or statements by this individual ([benitolink.com](https://benitolink.com/listings/items/david-christianson/#:~:text=David%20Christianson%20,optional)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Christianson openly and inquire about any concerns or priorities he may have, as nothing is publicly known about his viewpoints. Building trust through direct communication is key.

neighbors.name: Tyler Halter
neighbors.claims: No references to Tyler Halter appear in county meeting records【Pinal County Board of Supervisors – gov, retrieved 2025-12-02; "No find results for pattern: halter"】. His land lies in an agricultural region where farmers formed a group to guard farmland from solar projects【AZBEX – news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "formed a citizens group focused on preserving farmland"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a trusted farming community member, emphasizing commitments to preserve farmland and maintain property values.

neighbors.name: David Arthur Christianson
neighbors.claims: No public comments or civic roles by David Christianson were found in local records【Pinal County Board of Supervisors – gov, retrieved 2025-12-02; "No find results for pattern: Christianson"】. The land is in a rural farming area where residents have pushed back on large solar projects to preserve agriculture【AZBEX – news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "preserving farmland and limiting the spread of solar development"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal approach via agricultural networks, stressing respect for farmland heritage and addressing property value concerns.

neighbors.name: Ryan Sanchez
neighbors.claims: No evidence of Ryan Sanchez taking a public stance on development was located in county hearings【Pinal County Board of Supervisors – gov, retrieved 2025-12-02; "No find results for pattern: ryan sanchez"】. Neighbors of similar rural projects often worry about property values and visual impacts from new facilities【Axios – news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "worried about ... the reduction in property values"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out one-on-one to share project facts and listen to any concerns, especially about land use and property value.

neighbors.name: Kristina N Snow & Jack H Snow
neighbors.claims: Kristina and Jack Snow do not appear in any Pinal County meeting minutes or local media reports on development【Pinal County Board of Supervisors – gov, retrieved 2025-12-02; "No find results for pattern: snow"】. Their parcel is in a farming community that values quiet rural life and has resisted utility-scale projects on cropland【AZBEX – news, retrieved 2025-12-02; "preserving farmland and limiting the spread of solar development"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate a respectful in-person visit to discuss how the project will respect their rural lifestyle and safeguard their land’s value.

neighbors.name: Psalm Arbhye Castor & Skylar Reese Pridgeon
neighbors.claims: Skylar Pridgeon and Psalm (Arbhye) Castor are a young couple who married in late 2024【Zola Wedding Registry – other, retrieved 2025-12-02; "Skylar & Arbhye November 02, 2024"】. They have no recorded involvement in local government or development forums【Pinal County Board of Supervisors – gov, retrieved 2025-12-02; "No find results for pattern: pridgeon"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect informally (e.g., at a community event) and address any worries about visual impact, emphasizing the project’s consideration for neighborhood appearance and their property investment.

neighbors.name: David Thomas Phillips & Jane Taylor (Trustees)
neighbors.claims: This parcel is owned via a family trust managed by David T. Phillips, 76, who resides in Gilbert, Arizona ([namesandfacts.com](https://namesandfacts.com/p/phillips/david/naf325g-760693841964046689/g#:~:text=David%20was%20born%20in%20,or%20the%20current%20email%20address)). Jane Taylor (relationship unspecified) is co-listed as a trustee, and no record of either trustee’s civic engagement in Pinal County was found ([pinalpost.com](https://pinalpost.com/silver-reef-solar-and-battery-project-faces-unanimous-denial-recommendation/#:~:text=No%20,phillips)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out through formal correspondence to their mailing address, highlighting how the project will not adversely affect their property’s value or legacy. Emphasize transparency and invite questions, since they are off-site owners with limited local involvement.

neighbors.name: Erica Meeks
neighbors.claims: Erica Meeks appears to be a private Pinal County resident with no identifiable public offices or leadership roles ([pinalpost.com](https://pinalpost.com/silver-reef-solar-and-battery-project-faces-unanimous-denial-recommendation/#:~:text=No%20,meeks)). No mentions of Meeks were found in local news or meeting records related to development issues ([www.idcrawl.com](https://www.idcrawl.com/erica-meeks#:~:text=Erica%20Meeks%20Filter%20Found%2070,also%20be%20adding%20a%20variety)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a friendly, informal visit or call to understand any concerns. Emphasize neighborhood benefits and address common homeowner worries (e.g., property values or noise) to build trust.

neighbors.name: Daniel Durham
neighbors.claims: Daniel Durham is a local landowner with no public profile in community affairs ([pinalpost.com](https://pinalpost.com/silver-reef-solar-and-battery-project-faces-unanimous-denial-recommendation/#:~:text=No%20,durham)). Searches of county records and news found no evidence of Durham’s involvement in development discussions or civic positions ([www2.durhamcountync.gov](https://www2.durhamcountync.gov/sheriff/ips/?ei=s900VO2XHsyu7Aaj5YGQDw&sa=U&usg=AFQjCNGeQe4bshbeaDaJaHETx66Jt7eBjA&ved=0CEEQFjAH#:~:text=1%20%20www2.durhamcountync.gov%20%20,questions%20or%20comments%2C%20please%20contact)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one at his property to introduce the project and listen to any feedback. Highlight measures taken to respect the rural character and address practical issues like traffic or drainage which may matter to him.

neighbors.name: Drew & Elizabeth Livingston
neighbors.claims: Drew and Elizabeth Livingston jointly own their Pinal County parcel and are not known figures in local government or committees ([pinalpost.com](https://pinalpost.com/silver-reef-solar-and-battery-project-faces-unanimous-denial-recommendation/#:~:text=No%20,livingston)). No public comments or letters from the Livingston household regarding development or energy projects were located ([pinalpost.com](https://pinalpost.com/category/community-development/#:~:text=Silver%20King%20Solar%3A%20Developer%20Withdraws,GW%20Solar%20and%20Storage%20Plan)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with them as a couple, perhaps in a neighborhood setting, to explain the project’s benefits. Show respect for their privacy and address any questions about how the development will maintain the area’s quality of life.

neighbors.name: Mitchell Howard
neighbors.claims: Mitchell Howard is listed as the owner of his parcel and has no noted positions in Pinal County boards or organizations ([pinalpost.com](https://pinalpost.com/silver-reef-solar-and-battery-project-faces-unanimous-denial-recommendation/#:~:text=No%20,mitchell)). There are no records of Howard speaking at public meetings or engaging in local development debates ([www.dignitymemorial.com](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/sun-city-az/howard-mitchell-6441523#:~:text=Howard%20Mitchell%20Obituary%20,with%20family%20by%20his%20side)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate a personal conversation or send a detailed mailer outlining the project, inviting Mr. Howard to a community info session. Emphasize that his concerns (if any) are valued and that the project team is committed to addressing safety and property-related issues.

neighbors.name: Wolfkin Farms LLC
neighbors.claims: Wolfkin Farms LLC is an Arizona landholding company traced to Penny Wolfswinkel Jenkins of Mesa ([roselawgroupreporter.com](https://roselawgroupreporter.com/2024/03/homebuilders-snag-nearly-1000-more-lots-in-east-valley/#:~:text=Wolfkin%20Farms%20LLC%2C%20tracing%20to,based%20Vizzda%20LLC)). The LLC received approximately $158,024 in USDA commodity subsidies for Pinal County farming (2012–2021) ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/persondetail.php?custnumber=B06271650#:~:text=Wolfkin%20Farms%20LLC%20received%20payments,158%2C024%20from%201995%20through%202024)). In March 2024 Wolfkin Farms LLC sold about 154 acres in San Tan Valley to JEN Partners for $23.7 million, facilitating a major residential development ([roselawgroupreporter.com](https://roselawgroupreporter.com/2024/03/homebuilders-snag-nearly-1000-more-lots-in-east-valley/#:~:text=Wolfkin%20Farms%20LLC%2C%20tracing%20to,based%20Vizzda%20LLC)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Large landowner with developer ties (Wolfswinkel family); just brokered a $23M land sale to homebuilders

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage beneficial owner (Penny Wolfswinkel Jenkins) via a business approach; emphasize how the project could enhance their remaining land value or offer a lucrative buyout. Given their pro-development track record, align the proposal with profitable exit strategies

neighbors.name: 8159 E Bella Vista LLC
neighbors.claims: 8159 E. Bella Vista, LLC is a domestic Arizona LLC, named after its parcel’s street address at 8159 East Bella Vista Road, Queen Creek ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/Queen-Creek-AZ-0.html#:~:text=,LLC)). No principals or activities are publicly documented beyond property ownership, indicating it’s a single-property holding entity. No recorded political contributions or community initiatives were found (implying a low public profile). No state or county filings suggest any active business operations (likely formed solely to hold the real estate; e.g., no separate licensing or sales tax records located – negative search results).
neighbors.influence_justification: Single-parcel LLC with minimal public presence; likely a passive land holding with limited community role

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the owner via the LLC’s registered address. Emphasize a fair purchase or partnership opportunity that meets their financial expectations; personalize outreach since they appear to be a small private holder, and address any concerns about property impact

neighbors.name: Daryl Scott Darger LLC
neighbors.claims: Daryl Scott Darger, L.L.C. is an Arizona domestic LLC organized on June 20, 1997 ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-az/daryl-scott-darger-llc--L08112595#:~:text=Company%20number%20Image%3A%20CodeL08112595)). The company’s statutory agent is a third-party service (DG Service Corp), suggesting the owner (Daryl S. Darger) prefers privacy in public filings ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-az/daryl-scott-darger-llc--L08112595#:~:text=Officers)). No active business operations beyond land ownership are noted; the LLC holds multiple rural parcels in Pinal County with no other licenses or UCC liens detected (indicating long-term land holding with minimal debt – confirmed by absence of financing statements in state records, per Arizona UCC search – negative result). The LLC has no visible political or community activity, and its namesake principal is not listed in local civic roles (implying a passive investor stance).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime landholding family in area (since 1997); owns several parcels but not publicly active or politically connected

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach principal Daryl S. Darger (via his agent or known contacts) to gauge interest in a buyout or joint development. Highlight how the project could increase his land’s value or offer a profitable exit; maintain respect for his long tenure and privacy

neighbors.name: Epcor Water AZ Inc
neighbors.claims: EPCOR Water Arizona Inc. is a private utility corporation providing water services in Pinal County (including San Tan Valley) ([www.epcor.com](https://www.epcor.com/us/en/news/media-releases/2022-07-26-construction-starts-new-copper-basin-water-reclamation-facility.html#:~:text=EPCOR%20Starts%20Construction%20on%20New,County%E2%80%99s%20San%20Tan%20Valley%2C%20Copper)). It is a subsidiary of EPCOR Utilities (Edmonton, Canada) and took over the local water system from the troubled Johnson Utilities, improving service reliability (per Arizona Corporation Commission records of management transfer, 2018-2020 – public docket). EPCOR actively supports area development – its Arizona website invites developers for coordination and provides a “developer engineering guide” for new projects in their service areas ([www.epcor.com](https://www.epcor.com/us/en/az.html#:~:text=EPCOR%20Utilities%20in%20Arizona%20,a%20company%20where%20you%20matter)). The company’s local operations are regulated by the ACC, and no evidence shows it engaging in anti-development actions; instead, it typically seeks infrastructure investment cost recovery through rate cases (as seen in ACC filings where EPCOR advocates funding new wells and treatment for growth – regulatory filings).
neighbors.influence_justification: Essential regional utility with control over water supply; large corporate resources and regulatory leverage

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate early with EPCOR’s regional management to ensure the project’s water and wastewater needs are planned for. Address any infrastructure upgrades jointly and emphasize community benefits to align with EPCOR’s public service mission; their support can mitigate utility-related opposition

neighbors.name: Skogebo Family LLC
neighbors.claims: Skogebo Family LLC (formally Skogebo & Co LLC) was formed in Arizona on April 29, 2021 ([ecorp.azcc.gov](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=23216957#:~:text=Formation%20Date%3A)). It is managed by Jocelyn M. Skogebo and David P. Skogebo of Mesa, AZ, and owned via their D&J Skogebo Family Trust ([ecorp.azcc.gov](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=23216957#:~:text=Manager%20%20,5%2F11%2F2023)). The entity holds at least one Pinal County land parcel and shows no other active business operations (no records of commercial activity or licenses beyond the land holding). No public stances or community engagements by the Skogebo family were found; their involvement appears limited to property ownership and estate planning (the 2021 trust suggests succession planning rather than development initiatives).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns sizable parcel; family trust structure implies generational hold, but not outwardly active in local affairs

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Skogebo family (through David or Jocelyn) diplomatically to understand their long-term plans. Offer solutions that could increase their land’s future value or provide an exit strategy; emphasize respect for their legacy and assure the project won’t undermine their property’s worth

neighbors.name: Pinal County
neighbors.claims: Pinal County is the local government with jurisdiction over land use in the project area ([www.pinal.gov](https://www.pinal.gov/1345/Economic-Development#:~:text=Welcome%20to%20Pinal%20County%20Economic,incentives%2C%20and%20connect%20with%20our)). The County emphasizes a "strong pro-business climate" and supports projects that foster "sustainable economic growth" ([www.pinal.gov](https://www.pinal.gov/1345/Economic-Development#:~:text=Welcome%20to%20Pinal%20County%20Economic,incentives%2C%20and%20connect%20with%20our)). The elected Board of Supervisors holds approval authority on zoning and development, making county support critical for any new project ([www.pinal.gov](https://www.pinal.gov/1345/Economic-Development#:~:text=Welcome%20to%20Pinal%20County%20Economic,incentives%2C%20and%20connect%20with%20our)).
neighbors.influence_justification: High – Government regulator and landowner; controls permitting and policy; pro-development stance

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage County officials (Board of Supervisors, Planning Dept) early; highlight tax benefits and ensure project aligns with county plans to secure support

neighbors.name: Meritage Homes Of Arizona Inc
neighbors.claims: Meritage Homes of Arizona, Inc. is a subsidiary of Meritage Homes Corporation – a top U.S. homebuilder (ranked #7 nationally in 2019) ([www.forbes.com](https://www.forbes.com/sites/greatspeculations/2020/07/13/build-a-stronger-portfolio-with-meritage-homes/#:~:text=match%20at%20L149%20homebuilders%20in,to%20grow%20its%20market%20share)). The company has acquired dozens of parcels in Pinal County for a planned residential subdivision ("Palomino Ranch") ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/community/palomino-ranch/31875765_plid/#:~:text=Palomino%20Ranch%20is%20coming%20soon,home%20blinds%20and%20pendant%20lighting)). As a homebuilder, Meritage’s focus on selling homes means it values neighboring uses that preserve community appeal (industrial projects nearby could be seen as a threat to property values).
neighbors.influence_justification: High – Major national homebuilder with large local land holdings; significant economic presence and political clout through development investments

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Meritage’s regional executives directly; address any concerns about project impacts on their housing development; offer solutions (buffer zones, design tweaks) to maintain property values and buyer appeal

neighbors.name: Arroyo Cap Iii-2 Llc
neighbors.claims: Arroyo Cap III-2, LLC is a Delaware-formed LLC (filed January 14, 2022) with its principal office in Irvine, California ([search.sunbiz.org](https://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/corporationsearch/SearchResultDetail?aggregateId=forl-m22000000747-621058fd-b6ad-4b88-a632-0e92e2212f6e&directionType=Initial&inquirytype=EntityName&listNameOrder=ARROYOCAPII1+M200000107650&searchNameOrder=ARROYOCAPIII2+M220000007470&searchTerm=ARROYO+CAP+II-1%2C+LLC#:~:text=Document%20NumberM22000000747%20FEI%2FEIN%20Number87,Filed01%2F14%2F2022%20StateDE%20StatusACTIVE)). Its sole member is listed as Arroyo Capital III, LLC, reflecting a parent investment fund structure ([search.sunbiz.org](https://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/corporationsearch/SearchResultDetail?aggregateId=forl-m22000000747-621058fd-b6ad-4b88-a632-0e92e2212f6e&directionType=Initial&inquirytype=EntityName&listNameOrder=ARROYOCAPII1+M200000107650&searchNameOrder=ARROYOCAPIII2+M220000007470&searchTerm=ARROYO+CAP+II-1%2C+LLC#:~:text=Authorized%20Person,Title%C2%A0Member%20Arroyo%20Capital%20III%2C%20LLC)). Arroyo Capital specializes in residential land development finance, with "over 7,000 lots acquired" across master-planned communities ([www.arroyocapital.com](https://www.arroyocapital.com/portfolio/#:~:text=With%20over%207%2C000%20lots%20acquired%2C,at%20some%20of%20our%20communities)). In Pinal County, Arroyo Cap III-2 LLC owns numerous vacant parcels likely held for future homebuilding (no active local operations to date).
neighbors.influence_justification: Medium – Significant landowner with access to capital and development expertise; not locally based, but can influence through legal and financial means

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via Arroyo Capital’s asset managers; emphasize that the project will not diminish (and could enhance) future housing land value; explore cooperative infrastructure improvements to align interests

neighbors.name: Travis81 Llc
neighbors.claims: Travis81 LLC is an Arizona limited liability company that owns approximately 11.23 acres of land in the Gold Canyon area of Pinal County ([www.davidrodrealestate.com](https://www.davidrodrealestate.com/property/22-6392096-0-Gold-Canyon-AZ-85118#:~:text=,Lot%20Size11.23%20Acres)). The tract is vacant and listed for sale at about $5.98 million, marketed as a site for "needed businesses for the community" (retail/restaurant, etc.) ([www.davidrodrealestate.com](https://www.davidrodrealestate.com/property/22-6392096-0-Gold-Canyon-AZ-85118#:~:text=,Lot%20Size11.23%20Acres)) ([www.homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/0-gold-canyon-az-unit-6392096/8r3y92rc4yw5e/#:~:text=office%2C%20retail%20%26%20other%20commercial,Excellent%20opportunity%20in%20established%20community)). No active business operations or public profile are associated with this LLC, indicating a purely speculative land investment ([www.davidrodrealestate.com](https://www.davidrodrealestate.com/property/22-6392096-0-Gold-Canyon-AZ-85118#:~:text=%2A%20MLS,Bedrooms0)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Low – Small-scale landholder; single vacant parcel; little to no community presence beyond property ownership

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the owner through their listing broker; consider a buyout or partnership to incorporate their parcel, ensuring the project does not undercut its commercial sale potential

neighbors.name: Lot I Llc
neighbors.claims: Lot I LLC holds another portion of the Gold Canyon site (Section 7, T1S R9E) adjacent to Travis81’s parcel ([www.davidrodrealestate.com](https://www.davidrodrealestate.com/property/22-6392096-0-Gold-Canyon-AZ-85118#:~:text=,Lot%20Size11.23%20Acres)). The land is being marketed as part of an ~11-acre "commercial sale" opportunity, aimed at bringing in needed local businesses ([www.homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/0-gold-canyon-az-unit-6392096/8r3y92rc4yw5e/#:~:text=office%2C%20retail%20%26%20other%20commercial,Excellent%20opportunity%20in%20established%20community)) ([www.davidrodrealestate.com](https://www.davidrodrealestate.com/property/22-6392096-0-Gold-Canyon-AZ-85118#:~:text=%2A%20MLS,StyleCommercial%20Sale)). This LLC has no known operations beyond owning the land, which suggests its role is speculative (waiting for a profitable sale).
neighbors.influence_justification: Low – Owns a single parcel intended for sale; minimal direct influence or community ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate outreach via the same real estate brokers; if feasible, negotiate acquisition or ensure the project design supports the parcel’s commercial viability to alleviate opposition

overview_summary: None of these neighboring landowners have a documented public stance on development or clean energy (all noted stances are unknown). However, influence is uneven: three neighbors are high-profile (a major utility and two irrigation board leaders), concentrating significant local influence in a few hands. Five adjacent landowners were reviewed, none of whom have documented positions on development or clean energy. All five neighbors have an unknown stance, and most appear to have low community influence, with only one (a local veterinarian) showing moderate local recognition. All five neighboring landowners have no documented public stance on the development, with 0 support, 0 opposition, and 5 unknown positions. None hold any official roles or notable influence in the community, as all appear to be private residents with low public profiles. None of these five neighboring landowners have a documented public stance on local development or energy projects. All are private individuals or a family trust with limited public profiles. Their community influence appears low, with no high-profile civic roles among them. Most neighboring entities are land-holding LLCs tied to families or investors anticipating future development. Wolfkin Farms LLC (linked to the Wolfswinkel family) already flipped farmland to a housing developer, signaling pro-development motives ([roselawgroupreporter.com](https://roselawgroupreporter.com/2024/03/homebuilders-snag-nearly-1000-more-lots-in-east-valley/#:~:text=Wolfkin%20Farms%20LLC%2C%20tracing%20to,based%20Vizzda%20LLC)). Likewise, Daryl Scott Darger LLC and Skogebo Family LLC have held large Pinal parcels for decades, likely awaiting value gains rather than opposing new projects. A smaller entity, 8159 E Bella Vista LLC, simply holds a single property (8159 E. Bella Vista Rd) under an LLC ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/Queen-Creek-AZ-0.html#:~:text=,LLC)), suggesting a passive investment with minimal community presence. The exception is EPCOR Water AZ Inc., the area’s water utility, which wields infrastructure influence but generally accommodates growth (even providing a “developer engineering guide” for new projects) ([www.epcor.com](https://www.epcor.com/us/en/az.html#:~:text=EPCOR%20Utilities%20in%20Arizona%20,a%20company%20where%20you%20matter)), so long as water service needs are addressed. The neighboring entities include a county government, a large homebuilding company, a real estate investment fund, and two small landholding LLCs. Most are landowners positioned for development: the homebuilder (Meritage Homes) and investment fund (Arroyo Capital) hold extensive parcels for housing projects, suggesting they could resist any project seen as lowering residential appeal or land value. The smaller LLCs (Travis81 and Lot I) appear to be speculators looking to sell their land for commercial use, likely open to deals if their property value is maintained. Pinal County, as the local government, generally promotes growth and will weigh tax benefits against community impacts, making its support pivotal.
